User guide

There are two modes of using codeare: In a stand-alone and in a client-server fashion. Both interface behave similarly with the difference that the client-server invocation will reqiure some additional information.

Local interface

The local interface is utilised by invocing lclient command line interface or by using the Connector<LocalConnector> from the C++ API. 

		
codeare local client 1.0b
Commit 4ec211cb [Fri Jun 8 22:17:51 2012 +0200]

Usage:
lclient -t <test> [OPTIONS] package

  -t, --test    Test case (default: DummyRecon. Just connectivity test)
  -b, --base    Working directory.
  -d, --data    Binary data (HDF5, SyngoMR, MATLAB, NIFTI)
  -p, --pulses  Pulses (Only excitation).

  -h, --help    Print this help screen

Remote interface

The remote interface is utilised by invocing lclient command line interface or by using the Connector<RemoteConnector> from the C++ API.
